item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

	itemDef.anInt165 = 25;
	itemDef.anInt200 = 25;

That model is being overwritten by a different model in the client.

item.title: Model Help
item.dc:creator: @i_want_fire i want fire
item.description:
@i_want_fire wrote:

Hey everyone I have been using Aggroth V2 (I know itâ€™s not the best to use but i just wanted to mess around) and I ran into a problem that I have never seen before. Watch the video and see what happens when I wear the items I added in. [youtube]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0wZUuEdFyuM&feature=youtu.be[/youtube]

The ints I used are

case 614: itemDef.modelid = 24; itemDef.name = "Double Halo Sword" ; itemDef.description = "A Flapping Awesome Sword"; itemDef.modelZoom = 1616; itemDef.modelRotationY = 396; itemDef.modelRotationX = 1050; itemDef.modelOffset1 = 4; itemDef.modelOffset2 = -3; itemDef.anInt165 = 25; itemDef.anInt200 = 25; itemDef.groundActions = new String[5]; itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take"; itemDef.itemActions = new String[5]; itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear"; itemDef.itemActions[4] = "Drop"; break;

From what I know the .dat I used is correct and I even found it being released with the same .dat for the double halo so if anyone could help me with this I would appreciate it! c:

Read full topic
